GET /api.description: Returns a JSON object containing all of the available endpoints of the api, and their descriptions.

GET /api/topics.description: Returns an array of topic object

GET /api/articles.description: Returns an array containing a list of all the articles. Each article object includes a comment_count, while also excluding the body field. This endpoint supports sorting and ordering via query parameters, as well as filtering by topic.

articles.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
articles.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: Returns a single article object, specified by its corresponding article_id

article.title: Running a Node App
article.author: jessjelly
article.body: This is part two of a series on how to get up and running with Systemd and Node.js. This part dives deeper into how to successfully run your app with systemd long-term, and how to set it up in a production environment.

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Returns an array of comment objects, selected via article_id, and sorted by created_at in descending order.

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Adds a comment to the specified article, via article_id. Post requires a username, and a comment body of text in order to post a comment. Responds with a newly created comment object

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: Updates the vote count of the specified article, via article_id, by the provided amount.

article.author: butter_bridge

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Deletes a comment, when given the appropriate comment_id. Responds with 204 and no content (an empty object).

GET /api/users.description: Returns an array containing all users, each user stored in an object.
